author: bondservant2
title: And...here...we...go.... time to eject. How to best break it to the kids and move on... - Page 1 - AR15.COM
text:
Cannot take the crazy anymore. It took a long time to actually figure it out. After reading up on Borderline Personality Disorder it's all too apparent. She exhibits all the traits and is an expert at the manipulation / control thing and now that I see it, I can't move past it. For about 2-years I thought I could live with it for the kids sake - and hey, I'm pretty Independent and really only need sex - which she delivered in spades. But her need for validation and accolades has consumed her life and, well, there's just no room for me anymore. Not as an individual me anyway.
Don't really care what it's going to cost financially anymore. I'm in my mid-60's and can work for another 10-years.
What I really worry about are the kids. Specifically, the 12-year-old-boy. Our 17-year-ols girl won't really struggle too much if she can keep her head straight. She's very smart. very pretty, a hard worker and quite a musician / singer.
We adopted my boy very young and he has (generic term) Fetal Alcohol Syndrome. He's smart (good IQ) but poor rational thinking skills. He's obstinate and VERY argumentative. He's going to have a rough go in Life. I need to focus on getting him prepared for after I am gone.
Side note: this has actually been a problem for the BPD because of the time I spend with him and care given to him. If that sounds weird (it is) look up Borderline Personality Disorder and all the F'd-up things they think / do.
Anyway - I told her today that I want a divorce and I grabbed a few things to go stay the night away from home. Trying to clear my head - and also get my focus on the next steps. I want to have the kids for New Years Eve into New Years Day and I'm going to have to explain what's going on.
I'm sure the 17-year-old won't be surprised - the boy on the other hand won't like it at all. He will most likely argue that I need to go fix it.
Sigh - thanks for letting me vent. Probably be doing a lot of that..

author: O TEMPO Cidades
title: Comunidade Morro Alto, na Grande BH, vai receber prestação de serviços jurídicos de graça | O Tempo
text: O Mutirão do Gcriva, iniciativa oferecerá orientação jurídica e assistência à comunidade do Morro Alto, em Vespasiano, será realizado no dia 26 de setembro. Serão disponibilizados à população a prestação de serviços nas áreas de Direito Civil, Direito das Famílias, Sucessões, Consumidor, Vizinhança e dos Direitos das Pessoas com Deficiência. O atendimento será feito das 13 às 17 horas. A iniciativa é do Núcleo de Práticas Jurídicas da universidade Faseh, em parceria com Gcriva - Grupo Criança em Busca de uma Nova Vida (Rua Quatro, n° 277, Nova Pampulha, Vespasiano). A Coordenadora do Núcleo de Práticas Jurídicas da Faseh, Ana Cristina Nilson Gurgel, destaca a importância dos mutirões. “A interação direta dos graduandos em Direito com a comunidade do Morro Alto é sempre uma experiência profissional enriquecedora. Os alunos têm a oportunidade de compreender melhor as realidades e desafios enfrentados por populações vulneráveis, desenvolver empatia e um senso de responsabilidade social. Essa vivência também reforça a importância do papel do advogado como agente de transformação social”. A novidade dos mutirões desse semestre é a inclusão dos atendimentos às Pessoas com Deficiência, conforme salienta Ana Cristina. “Isso demonstra a preocupação e o compromisso da Faseh com a inclusão. Como fase preparatória, os alunos participarão de três palestras, ao longo do semestre sobre direitos, documentação e legislação sobre o apoio e o suporte às necessidades especificas deste público”. Durante os eventos, os alunos do curso de Direito da Faseh “terão a oportunidade de lidar diretamente com casos reais, desenvolvendo habilidades analíticas e críticas para a atuação jurídica; atuar como conciliadores, aplicando métodos para a resolução eficiente dos litígios e, ainda, resolver demandas específicas de Pessoas com Deficiência”, acrescenta a coordenadora. Neste segundo semestre, serão realizados mais dois mutirões jurídicos, agendados para os dias 31 de outubro e 21 de novembro.

author: Genevieve St. Clair
title: Canadian Man Nathaniel Veltman Gets Life in Prison for Intentionally Running Over Muslim Family
text: A Canadian judge has deemed the intentional running over of five members of a Muslim family in 2021 to “constitute terrorist activity.” Canadian man gets life for running over Muslim family A Canadian judge has ruled that the intentional running over of a Muslim family in 2021 constitutes terrorist activity. Nathaniel Veltman, now 23, was found guilty of first-degree murder for the attack, which targeted the family because of their Islamic faith. Justice Served for Hate-Fueled Attack In a landmark ruling, Judge Pomerance emphasized the attack as a textbook example of terrorist motive and intent, highlighting the hate that fueled the offender’s actions. The terrorism designation acknowledges the ugliness that took the lives of the victims and the prevalence of hate in society. Impact on the Muslim Community The ruling has been welcomed by relatives of the victims, who acknowledged the hate that fueled the attack. This landmark decision sends a powerful message about the consequences of hate-fueled violence and the need to combat prejudice and racism in society. Veltman faces 25 years in prison without the option of parole for the attack on the Muslim family in London, Ontario.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Buffalo Bills Cancel Thursday Practice Due to Winter Storm Woes
text:
Buffalo Bills Cancel Thursday Practice Due to Winter Storm Woes
The Buffalo Bills canceled practice on Thursday due to severe winter storm conditions that dumped over 30 inches of snow on Orchard Park. In light of safety concerns, particularly with travel bans in place, the team opted for a virtual meeting. The Bills, coming off a loss to the Los Angeles Rams despite Josh Allen's impressive six-touchdown game, are preparing to face the Detroit Lions this Sunday in what could shape up as a Super Bowl preview.
- 30 inches of snow accumulated in the Orchard Park area.
- The Bills are currently 10-3, while the Lions hold a 12-1 record.
- The Bills have secured their fifth consecutive AFC East title.
- They are tied with the Pittsburgh Steelers for the AFC’s second seed, two games behind the Kansas City Chiefs.
This Sunday, the Bills will attempt to defeat the Lions, aiming to hand them only their second loss of the season and bolster their playoff position amidst a tough road schedule.
Bottom LineThe cancellation of practice highlights the impact of severe weather on professional sports, emphasizing safety while the Bills gear up for a crucial game that may influence their postseason aspirations.
Read more at TotalProSports
